Key:
(Dinner's over. Now I can finally take a break.
Today felt especially long. I wanna get to bed
already, but I need to wash the dishes.)

(But I can't shake the sight of Maria in that
black outfit. Maybe I should find a time to
bring it up to her?)
Hm?

(Maria is leaving through the front door.
I wonder what's wrong.)
What are you doing, Maria? It's cold.
I am fine. I wanted to look up at the stars.
(Maria said this, gazing up at the night sky.)
You like star-gazing, don't you?
How did you know...?
Intuition, I guess. Just had a feeling.

(The Maria I saw at Takadai Park earlier and
the one in front of me were floating. Their auras
may be different, but they are linked somehow.)

That's not why I asked, though. I figured you
liked looking at the stars. Am I wrong?
You are not wrong. Although there is more to it.

I see. If you stay out here for too long, you
might catch a cold. Let's head home.
Okay.

(Maria spun on her heel and walked quietly
towards the front door. All of a sudden, I asked
her a question.)
Hey, Maria? Do you have a family?
Family...?
For example, um... a younger or older sister?

A sister...? No. I have no memory of such a
thing, nor are there records to indicate so.
Got it. Sorry for the weird question.

It is fine. However, in exchange for me
accepting your date proposal, promise me
something.
Sure, what is it?
Will you invite me on a date tomorrow, too?
That's no problem at all. I promise I will.
Yes. It is a promise, yes?

Yep. All right, then. Let's head inside the
house.

(Maria returned to the house with a spring
in her step, almost like she was dancing. I
followed her inside and shut the door.)
(And so, the long day had come to an end.)
